metadata.Title: CVE-2022-2505 on Ubuntu 23.04 (lunar) - medium
metadata.Description:
Mozilla developers and the Mozilla Fuzzing Team reported memory safety bugspresent in Firefox 102. Some of these bugs showed evidence of memorycorruption and we presume that with enough effort some of these could havebeen exploited to run arbitrary code. This vulnerability affects FirefoxESR < 102.1, Firefox < 103, and Thunderbird < 102.1.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-2505` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

thunderbird - 1:102.3.3+build1-0ubuntu1
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:102.3.3+build1-0ubuntu1
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:102.3.3+build1-0ubuntu1
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:102.3.3+build1-0ubuntu1
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:102.3.3+build1-0ubuntu1
xul-ext-lightning - 1:102.3.3+build1-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: thunderbird package in lunar, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1:102.3.3+build1-0ubuntu1').
mozjs78 package in lunar is affected and may need fixing.
